titlepage.subtitle: Finding Aid
titlepage.sponsor: Encoding funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.
titlepage.p: Â© 2003 Smith College. All rights reserved.

did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: Birth control collection
did.abstract: This small collection is comprised of mostly books, plus some pamphlets, flyers, and other. Documents uses and misuses of contraception; family planning; sex in marriage; sex instruction; histories of the treatment of contraception by the church; population problems; fertility; and sterility.

daodesc.p: Article "Poor Black Women," one of a series on female liberation chosen by Boston-area women and published by New England Free Press, 1968

scopecontent.p: This small collection is comprised of mostly books, plus one box of pamphlets, flyers, and other publications dating from 1923 to 2000, with the bulk of the materials dating from the 1930s. Topics relate primarily to uses and misuses of contraception; family planning; sex in marriage; sex instruction; histories of the treatment of contraception by the church; population problems; fertility; and sterility.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research according to the regulations of the Sophia Smith Collection.

userestrict.p: Material in this collection may be protected by copyright. It is the responsibility of the researcher to identify and satisfy all copyright holders. Permission to publish reproductions or quotations beyond "fair use" must also be obtained from the Sophia Smith Collection as owners of the physical property.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Birth Control Collection, Sophia Smith Collection, Smith College, Northampton, Mass.

accruals.head: Additions to the Collection
accruals.p: Periodic additions to collection are expected.

acqinfo.p: Most of the books in this collection were transferred from Neilson Library, Smith College. Other materials were either purchased or given to the Sophia Smith Collection by various donors.

processinfo.p: Finding aid revised in 2002. Recent additions may not be reflected in the finding aid.

did.unittitle: General
Publications and fliers, 1950-2002, undated
Birth control methods (handwritten and unidentified), undated
Lanteen Brown diaphram box
Books on Shelf
A Thousand Marriages: A Medical Study of Sex Adjustment, by Robert Latou Dickinson and Lura Beam, 1931 [foreword by Havelock Ellis]
And the Poor Get Children, by Lee Rainwater and Karol Kane Weinstein, 1960
Biological and Medical Aspects of Contraception: Papers and Discussions Presented at the American Conference on Birth Control and National Recovery, edited by Margaret Sanger, 1934
Birth Control and the State: A Plea and Forecast, by C.P. Blacker, 1926
Birth Control: Its Use and Misuse, by Dorothy Dunbar Bromley, 1934 [introduction by R. L. Dickinson]
Birth Control Today: A Practical Approach to Intelligent Family Planning, by Leon F. Whitley, 1960
Birth Control in Practice: Analysis of Ten Thousand Case Histories of the Birth Control Clinical Research Bureau, by Marie F. Kopp, 1933
Birth Control on Trial, by Lella Secor Florence, 1930 [foreword by Sir Humphrey Rolleston, Bart.; introductory note by F.H.A. Marshall]
Contraception: A History of its Treatment by the Catholic Theologians and Canonists, by John T. Noonan, Jr., 1965
Controlled Fertility: An Evaluation of Clinic Services, by Regine K. Stix and Frank W. Notestein, 1940
Family Planning Movement in Japan, published by The Population Problems Research Council, 1953 [contents include speech by Margaret Sanger, essay by Shoichi Arai
Family Limitation, by John Ryan, 1956 [foreword by Alan Keenan]
Fertility and Sterility in Marriage: Their Voluntary Promotion and Limitation, by Th. H. Van De Velde; translated by F. W. Stella Browne, 1934
The Fifth International Conference on Planned Parenthood: Report of the Proceedings [Theme: Overpopulation and Family Planning], published by International Planned Parenthood Federation, 1955
Fruits of Philosophy or the Private Consumption of Adult People, by Charles Knowlton, 1937 [edited by Norman Hines]
Medical History of Contraception, by Norman Himes, 1936 [foreword by R.L. Dickinson]
The Modern Method of Birth Control, by Thurston S. Welton, 1935
Population and Planned Parenthood in India, by S. Chandrasekhar, 1955 [introduction by Julian Huxley]
The Power of the Pill: Oral Contraceptives and Women's Career and Marriage Decisions, by Claudia Golden and Laurence F. Katz, 2000
The Practice of Contraception, edited by Margaret Sanger and Hannah M. Stone, 1931 [foreword by R.L. Dickinson}
Report on the Sex Question by the Swedish Population Commission, translated and edited by Virginia Clay Hamilton, 1940
Seed: A Novel of Birth Control, by Charles G. Norris, 1940
Sex Problem in India, by N.S. Phadke, 1927 [foreword by Margaret Sanger]
The Single Woman: A Medical Study in Sex Education, by R. L. Dickinson and Lura Beam, 1934
The Third International Conference on Planned Parenthood: Report of the Proceedings, published by The Family Planning Association, 1952
Tomorrow's Children: Proceedings of the Southern Conference on Tomorrow's Children (held in Atlanta, GA, November 9-11, 1939), published by the Birth Control Federation of America, 1939
The Truth About the New Birth Control Pills, by John Devaney and Philip Reaves, 1961
Wise Parenthood: The Treatise on Birth Control for Married People, A Practical Sequel to "Married Love": eleventh edition, by Marie Carmichael Stopes, 1923 [introduction by Arnold Bennett]
